title: The Nursing Workforce Crisis: Retention Economics vs. Agency Spend
summary: Hospitals are trading margin for staffing stability. We analyze the $120/hr travel nurse premium and the operational ROI of internal float pools.

children.text: The post-pandemic labor market has permanently shifted the cost basis of care delivery. Reliance on external contract labor has moved from a 'stop-gap' measure to a structural liability.

body.alt: Chart comparing full-time employee cost vs travel nurse cost over 5 years
body.caption: Figure 1: The 'Margin Gap' - Agency labor costs have risen 40% faster than reimbursement rates.

children.text: For every $1.00 spent on a core staff RN, hospitals spend $2.40 for a travel equivalent. This wage disparity creates a toxic feedback loop: Core staff leave for agency roles, forcing the hospital to hire more agency staff.
Verdict: Systems investing in 'Internal Agencies' (Gig-work platforms for their own staff) report a 15% reduction in total labor spend within 12 months.
